name: set_energy_level
description: set the player character Samus' health level to a specific value

name: get_player_state
description: Gets the current state of the game (e.g. energy/HP, missiles/ammo, location/room/zone).

name: save_to_slot
description: saves the current state of the game emulator to the numbered slot index (it is a good idea to save the state of the game when the player makes important progress like collecting an item or leaving the first room)

slot_index.description: integer between 0 and 9 (1 is a good default to use)

name: load_from_slot
description: loads the state the state of the game emulator from the previously saved slot index

slot_index.description: integer between 0 and 9 (0 is a special slot for the start of the game)

name: evaluate_js_with_confirmation
description: runs javascript code in the context of the emulator's page (after prompting the user to confirm in a dialog box) -- use this powerful feature to do on-the-fly customizations of the UI

name: get_set_bits_from_packed_value
description: returns the indexes of the 1 bits in a packed integer value (e.g. 0b00001111 -> [0, 1, 2, 3])

name: get_next_step_on_plan_to_beat_game
description: returns the next step in the plan to beat the game based on the provided state by calling a planner system

nodeName.description: the name of the node to start from (e.g. 'Landing_Site_L2'). Node name combines a node name and a location within it. If the player's current closest node is null, instruct them to approach a door

items.description: a list of items that the player currently has (e.g. [0, 2, 3])

itemList.description: the items the player currently has

name: get_node_info
description: returns information about a specific node in the game (x positive goes to the right, y positive goes down). Use this tool to give the player a sense of the relative position of any nodes you name

nodeName.description: the name of the node to get information about (e.g. 'Landing_Site_L2')

name: set_whiteboard_content
description: Place visual content into the whiteboard area. Content such as text, images, or a map should be embedded into the board area. Use this to show visual diagrams, screenshots, list of goals or a focused map view.

msg.description: Content to place on the whiteboard. Use 'map' or 'show map' to render a map centered on the player, a full https://... image URL to embed an image, or Markdown/HTML text to render formatted content.

name: donwload_game_state
description: Downloads the current game state onto local files
